data.question: What is the chemical formula of CUK-1 material?

What method was used to perform the IAST calculations?
What is the space group of guest-loaded Co-CUK-1?
What is the main reason for the clear sorption inversion of CO2 over C2H2 in CUK-1 materials?
data.answer: The unique molecular arrangement or packing in the confined pore channels

data.question: Is the guest-guest interaction the dominant factor in the inverse CO2 sorption behavior of CUK-1 materials?
Does decreasing the temperature to 233 K increase the CO2 capacity in CUK-1 materials?
Can high-purity C2H2 (99.995%) be directly obtained in a one-step process using CUK-1?
What is the role of the μ3-OH group in the adsorption process within CUK-1?
data.answer: It acts as a potential binding site to guest molecules through electrostatic interactions

data.question: What technique was used to collect in-situ synchrotron X-ray powder diffraction data?
Is the adsorptive separation using CO2-selective materials preferable in the industry for producing pure C2H2?
What is the estimated isosteric heat of adsorption (ΔHads) of CO2 on Co-CUK-1?
Does the formation of CO2 tetramers in CUK-1 at low temperatures contribute to its high CO2 capacity?
What is the effect of varying the metal nodes in CUK-1 on the formation of guest clusters?
data.answer: There is only a subtle difference in host-guest interactions, which does not influence the formation of guest clusters

data.question: Can CUK-1 materials be easily regenerated at room temperature by purging an inert gas?
What is the main challenge addressed by the authors in utilizing ultramicroporous MOFs for gas capture?
data.answer: Enhancing selectivity through host-guest interactions tuning

data.question: Are the guest-guest interactions within confined nanovoids of porous materials well explored?
What does the Clausius-Clapeyron equation estimate in the context of gas adsorption?
Is the modular nature and reticular structure of ultramicroporous MOFs beneficial for controlling host-guest interactions?
What is the significance of the temperature-dependent reversal of sorption behavior for CO2 and C2H2 in CUK-1?
data.answer: It demonstrates the potential of CUK-1 for producing high-purity C2H2 by temperature-swing sorption
